WorkItem.ClosedComment: No specific reason for this in Rawr4.  Threat values need to re-normalized for the new system.
WorkItem.Description:
In my 56/8/7 blood tanking spec with gear from heroic instances, triumph badges and a few crafted items, RAWR calculates a TPS value of 16660,8. I selected vampiric blood, rune strike and death strike glyphs and the only raid buff I selected is horn of winter.
I have tested my actual TPS with the Skada threat module for about 1 hour against the elite bone sentinels in Icecrown and it averages out to about 6500, sometimes a little higher. The rotation I used was a standard IT-PS-HS-HS-DS-DC-DS-HS-HS-HS-HS-DC.
For my DW-frost spec, I get TPS calculations of about 7200 TPS, which I have no problem replicating against those same elite mobs.
Is the difference in calculated and actual TPS maybe an error in the TankDK module?
WorkItem.Summary: [TankDK] Exceedingly high threat values for blood tank spec

Comments.Message: Please don't create multiple copies of the same issue.  Reattaching my character profile that also exhibits this behavior.
Sorry for the double submission, my connection must have timed out when I was posting.
Something in the way I'm handling my DRune stuff.  Crap...  I'm getting the time closer to what I expect, but it's totally inflating the TPS numbers.
Ok... the values are still high, but better.  I found I had an off-by-one (order of magnitude) error in the Abominations Might implementation.
